conclusion: Consider contributions from each of the four charges.
Square with side length L, +q charges at A and B, -q charges at C and D, intersection of diagonals is the center.
Distance from each charge to the center is L/sqrt(2).
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Magnitude of electric field due to each charge is 2kq/L^2.
Electric field due to +q at A and B points away from A and B towards the center.
Electric field due to -q at C and D points towards C and D from the center.
Resolve electric fields into x and y components.
x-components of fields from A and B cancel, y-components of fields from C and D cancel.
Net electric field at the center of the square is zero.
